Addon.name: Dynamic Menu
Addon.CopyText: <AC type="DynamicMenu" Name="Dynamic Menu" QueryString="Menu=$menu name$&MenuNew=$Create New Menu$">
Addon.ArgumentList: Menu Name=Default[list(Dynamic Menus)] Create New Menu

Addon.name: Menu
Addon.ArgumentList: Create New Menu= Use Existing Menu=[listid(dynamic menus)]

Addon.name: Menu-Legacy
Addon.ArgumentList: Create New Menu= Use Existing Menu=[listid(dynamic menus)]

Addon.name: Menu Javascript

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this record. The name is generally used to identify the record in a list, and is often used as a caption when the record is displayed publicly

Field.Name: Active
Field.Caption: Active
Field.HelpDefault: Determines if this record is available to the system. An inactive record will not be displayed on the public site, and will not be available in lists of records. You can however, edit the record from the admin site.

Field.Name: SortOrder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: An alphanumeric string that can be used to sort sections on menus.

Field.Name: Caption
Field.Caption: Caption
Field.HelpDefault: The caption is the text displays on the public site when this section is added to a menu. To create a menu, add the Dynamic Menu Add-on to your template.

Field.Name: TemplateID
Field.Caption: Default Template
Field.HelpDefault: This is the template that will be used for this section when no template is set on individual pages. If this selection is blank, or set to Default, the Default template will be used.

Field.Name: RootPageID
Field.Caption: Root Page
Field.HelpDefault: This is the page that will display when this section is clicked on the public site. When creating a new menu, leave this entry blank and a Root Page will be created for you the first time the section displays on a menu, with the same name as the section.

Field.Name: ContentID
Field.Caption: Default Content
Field.HelpDefault: This selects the type of data that will be used for pages in this section. For new sections, if this is left blank it will automatically be set to Page Content when the section is first displayed. You can select other Content Definitions if you have multiple content managers who each have individual edit rights to different Content Definitions. For instance, if you want one person to edit just the 'About Us' section, use the 'Create Content Definition' tool to create a new Content Definition for the About Us pages, and assign that content definition to this section.

Field.Name: MenuImageFilename
Field.Caption: Menu Image
Field.HelpDefault: If your menus use graphic images, upload the image for this section here.

Field.Name: MenuImageOverFilename
Field.Caption: Menu Image Rollover
Field.HelpDefault: If your menus use graphic images, and you want a roll-over for your images, upload the roll-over image here.

Field.Name: HideMenu
Field.Caption: Hidden from Menus
Field.HelpDefault: Check this box if you want this section to be hidden from the public on all menus in which the section has been included. Those with edit rights to the section will still be able to see it on the menu. This is helpful during development when the section is on multiple menus.

Field.Name: BlockSection
Field.Caption: Blocked from Users
Field.HelpDefault: Check this box if you want this section to only be available to administrators, and those people who are in the groups selected in the Section Blocking tab.

Field.Name: MenuImageDownFilename
Field.Caption: Menu Image Current
Field.HelpDefault: If your menus use graphic images, this image will be used when this section is the current section. If blank, the Menu Image will be used.

Field.Name: menuImageDownOverFilename
Field.Caption: Menu Image Current Down
Field.HelpDefault: If your menus use graphic images, this image will be used when this section is the current section and the mouse is over this menu entry. If blank, the Menu Image Rollover will be used.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this record. The name is generally used to identify the record in a list, and is often used as a caption when the record is displayed publicly

Field.Name: Active
Field.Caption: Active

Field.Name: JavaScriptOnLoad
Field.Caption: onLoad Event
Field.HelpDefault: Include javascript commands to be run from the body's onLoad event

Field.Name: JSFilename
Field.Caption: In Head
Field.HelpDefault: Include any javascript code you would like added to the document's head. Do not include the script tags.

Field.Name: classTopWrapper
Field.Caption: Top Wrapper Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class in the top level ul

Field.Name: classTopList
Field.Caption: Top List Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class in the top level ul

Field.Name: classTopItem
Field.Caption: Top Item Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class in each li element of the top level ul

Field.Name: classItemActive
Field.Caption: Active Item Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class added to an item when it is the current page or section.

Field.Name: classTierWrapper
Field.Caption: Tier Wrapper Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class in the div wrapping each tier level ul

Field.Name: classTierList
Field.Caption: Tier List Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class in each tier level ul

Field.Name: classTierItem
Field.Caption: Tier Item Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class in each li element of a tier level ul

Field.Name: classItemFirst
Field.Caption: First Item Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class added to the first li of all lists

Field.Name: classItemLast
Field.Caption: Last Item Class
Field.HelpDefault: The class added to the last li of all lists

Field.Name: listStylesFilename
Field.Caption: Styles
Field.HelpDefault: When blank, this stylesheet automatically populates with the default styles when the menu first displays. It will be included on every page that includes this menu.

Field.Name: useJsFlyoutCode
Field.Caption: Use Javascript Flyout code
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, tier menus are displayed and blocked with javascript code that manages their position as well. Clear this box if you will use CSS to hide tier menus

Field.Name: classFlyoutParent
Field.Caption: Flyout Parent Class
Field.HelpDefault: Added to any menu entry that has a child flyout menu. It could be used to add marked designating there is a child menu.

Field.Name: classItemHover
Field.Caption: Hover Item Class
Field.HelpDefault: Added to an item when the mouse is hovering over it or any of its parent items.
